verses.roman:
bhaṭṭācārya kahe,--ekale tumi nā yāiha darśane
āmāra saṅge yābe, kimvā āmāra loka-sane

synonyms: bhaṭṭācārya kahe—the Bhaṭṭācārya said; ekale—alone; tumi—You; nā—not; yāiha—go; darśane—to see the Deity; āmāra saṅge—with me; yābe—You should go; kimvā—or; āmāra loka-sane—with my men.
translation: The Bhaṭṭācārya replied, "Do not go alone to see the Deity at the Jagannātha temple. It is better that You go with me or my men."
